title: Lasagna
description: This is my absolute favourite dish and it's really easy to make
story: This is the dish I like to make for my guests. It's so good with some red wine. I literraly can not stop eating it. </br></br>It takes some time to prepare, but the steps are all very easy. Definitely not good for those, who is on the diet :). </br></br>It gets even better next day.

ingredients.name: lasagna pasta
ingredients.preparationNotes: (It usually takes about 2/3 of the standard package)

ingredients.name: tomato, mozzarella and some basil leaves for decoration

instructions: Souté finely chopped onion on some olive oil.
Add grated carrot. Souté for about 7 minutes.
Add beef to the pan, mix well with onion and carrot, try to break all crumbs. Add salt, pepper, herbs and dried paprika.
Add canned tomatoes, beef bouillon, tomato paste. And cook covered for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile prepare bechamel sauce (you can substitute bechamel sauce with a sour cream or crème fraîche): melt butter in a sauce pan. Add flour. Mix very well.
Start gradually adding warm milk, keep whisking.
Once it gets thick - add some nutmeg, salt and some ground pepper.
Now it's time to assemble: in a slightly oiled pan place first layer of lasagna pasta, then cooked beef sauce, then some of the bechamel sauce or sour cream, then grated cheese.
Keep on adding new layers. I like all my layers be as thin as possible and all the same.
Decorate the top layer with cut tomatoes and mozzarella pieces, sprinkle some grated cheese.
Cook in 350F oven for 30 minutes covered with foil and for another 30 minutes uncovered.
Set to cool down for at least 10 minutes. Decorate with fresh basil leaves before serving.
Serve with grated parmigiano and red wine. Sounds like a dinner party! Enjoy!
